root.para: In order to meet the criteria for hedge accounting, the hedge must be highly effective. When certain conditions are met, the entity may assume that an interest rate swap will be completely effective in hedging benchmark interest rate risk. In that situation, the entity may elect to use the shortcut method discussed in paragraphs 102â€“117 of FASB ASC 815-20-25, thereby avoiding the need to formally assess hedging effectiveness at inception and on a continuing basis. In this case study, one of those conditions is not met because the interest rate swap matures one month later than the bond obligation.
